info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN LINCOLN AND NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge to 18 miles southwest of Mesa. Movement was west southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds near 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Roswell. This includes Highway 285 between Mile Markers 116 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
